body: Quite a lot of relevant discussion on the OkHttp issue that is linked to above https://github.com/square/okhttp/issues/3759
It has been established in https://github.com/square/okhttp/issues/3759 that this is a bug and non-compliant behavior with [RFC 1952](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc1952)

rename.from: Netty stops reading gzip response after a while
rename.to: JdkZlibDecoder stops after processing first GZIP stream, non-compliant with RFC 1952

rename.from: JdkZlibDecoder stops after processing first GZIP stream, non-compliant with RFC 1952
rename.to: JdkZlibDecoder ignores everything but first GZIP stream, non-compliant with RFC 1952

issue.title: Fixes #7566 by handling concatenated GZIP streams.

repository.name: netty
repository.description: Netty project - an event-driven asynchronous network application framework

issue.body:
Motivation:
According to [RFC 1952](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc1952), concatenation of valid gzip streams is also a valid gzip stream. `JdkZlibDecoder` only processed the first and discarded the rest.

Modifications:
- Introduced a constructor argument `decompressConcatenated` that if true, `JdkZlibDecoder` would continue to process the stream.

Result:
- Fixes #7566. 
- If `decompressConcatenated = true`, concatenated streams would be processed in
compliance with RFC 1952.
- If `decompressConcatenated = false` (default), existing behavior would remain.

body: @normanmaurer when will this fix be available on Maven Central?
@asarkar once we release... most likely end of the week or early next week.
